Comment: My problem with this reboot is that it is unnecessary; Sony wanted Spider-Man 4 to come out into 2011, so they could still keep the rights for Spidey; Sam Raimi, however, was worn out after shooting Spider-Man films for almost 10 years and said he would get it out in 2012; obviously Sony didn't want that and kept pushing him to put in things he didn't want ( like they did in Spider-Man 3), to the point where he quit, Sony still got out the Movie late, with the first being ok and the second being fucking horendous; Sony fucked up a chance for a possible AMAZING fourth Spider-Man movie but they decided to be assholes instead; piss off Sony;(ok, sorry, I went a bit insane there, but I just don't like Sony for this).

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment: There was so much here, making it seem like Peter was going to be trying to find the truth about his parents, while simultaneously being spider-man. Yes, he did somewhat try and find out about his parents, but not hardly like the trailer portrayed. Personally, I love this movie. I loved it for it's darker tone. I liked how he wasn't so much a superhero, but more of a vigilante. This movie was great, but the trailer made it out to be so much better. Apparently they changed it because the trailer was poorly received by fans, so they moved the finding the truth about his parents to TASM2.  You can tell that those who didn't like the trailer were just upset that the original Spider-man franchise was out of the picture. I loved the original as a kid. However, as I got older it seemed more and more... cheesy. Where this movie is a lot darker and realistic. I wish I could have seen what this movie was originally going to be. It seems like it would have been the best superhero film to date Imo.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment:
Despite the second movie not being very good, I can safely say as a spidey fan that this movie is incredibly underrated. Sure it has problems and it has sorta copied the original Raimi films and will never be as good as those, this movie still has a lot to love here. For example the cast is once again great and the romance between Peter and Gwen is FAR better than him and mj (Also at least Gwen actually did something other than just scream) 

Another thing to like here is the action (not visual effects) I love the originals just as much as the other guy, but I will agree that some of the action in the original movies kinda feel like an episode of power rangers. They don't really show how much spidey could move around and how fast ge really is. In this film, we get the best of Spidey's powers with the power of cgi. It may not look as impressive as the originals but it does improve the fight choreography.

This movie (and the second one) will never be as good as the originals but it does have a lot to offer and things we've never seen before in a spider man movie. Yeah sure the writing is flawed and the villain is kinda weak but it shouldn't stop many spidey fans from enjoying this movie with their true fanboyism (as long as they skip the second one)

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment: Personally I like both versions of Spiderman. both share a resemblance of the Spiderman from the comics. but I personally recommend the new Spiderman for it's creative and complex meaning.. and for the fact that it seems to understand the source material. while it has some flaws, you HAVE to give it some recommendation. Andrew Garfield has a better patrayal of what Spiderman should be. while Tobey Maguire seems to put a more adult and mature version of Spiderman, and more or less, shows a more corny and weird version of Spiderman. yeah, Tobey does, at times, show a the funny and goofy Spiderman, and gives the weird part of Peter Parker like we see in the comics, but it's just the fact that Tobey doesn't accurately show Peter's point of view, but he does give us a good Spiderman interpretation. and the villains are just weirdly formed, and yet, Sam Raime gave them time to develop, while the villains in the new film are rushed and aren't given time to develop. so as a result of these reasons, I chose both, but if I had to choose one it'd be the new Spiderman.

THUMBS UP IF YOU AGREE THAT THE ORIGINAL SPIDERMAN TRIOLOGY WAS THE BEST AND REBOOT FILMS SUCKS(ROBOCOP.TOTAL RECALL ,FRIGHT NIGHT ETC) ! ! !
how will you feel if after few years they opt for the remake of harry potter and the matrix ? wont you feel bad about it ? if something has acquired a cult status, dont destroy it by making a reboot ! ! !
spiderman had some iconic scenes like upside down kiss , bomb detonation on the face of spidey with his mask burning in slow motion etc . while amazing spiderman had non , it even feels like a video game not like a movie .
remember the poster of spiderman with mary jane in his arms and both are web swingin in the air ? so iconic . while the new one ahs nothing like that
kirsten dunst(red hair ,charming smile etc) was way more beautiful than emma stone who looks like a meth head .
all they want is money , they know that this had worked in the past , why not reboot it ? film houses should wake up and stop making reboots ! ! !

I liked the movie but it had a couple of problems. 
It was kind of hard to care about Connors as he wasn't relatable. They should have kept his family in the film.
I don't like to admit it, but Peter was a bit of a jerk (outside of being Spider-Man) after he got bit by the spider.

Other than those problems, I loved the movie.

Comment:
The thing about Avengers is it was made so that you don't have to watch the lead up to know what's going on. Everyone (including Fury) is introduced in Avengers in a way that sums up their backstory enough that you don't need to have watched the previous movies.
That aside, there's nothing worth seeing in the standalone heroes' movies. They don't add much to Avengers, and they're not that good on their own unless you just want something fun to watch.

Comment:
This  film is just a cynical attempt  to copy the Christopher Nolan batman  films. The dark and serious approach works well for a character like batman , but for spider-man, a character who's roots were in colorful 60's superhero comics, it just looks kinda silly.  

I hope the film flops so the film rights can revert back to marvel , but because the spiderman brand is so strong,  the film will be most likely be a hit even if the film sucks, sadly.  I aint watching it though.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment: I get that, but I was just referring to the general tone of the movie: Peter is being made out as a punk skateboarder, and his suit - especially the eyes - has a rather dark design. The whole father's legacy and Lizard genetics stuff are good elements if you're going for a more adult version of Spidey, but wasn't Spider-Man meant for kids originally? We're talking about a guy in a skin-tight red-and-blue suit cracking jokes. (Yeah, they've already done that version, but still...)

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment: Fair enough, but here's my question: does every super-hero movie need to be dark? I mean, Blade was dark. The X-Men films (the reboot especially) were mature, to say the least. But while I think DC's Batman reboot did the right thing in going the "dark n' gritty" route, does that mean every one of its fellows have to be like it? The Avengers, and most of the movie tie-ins before it, went in pretty much the opposite direction, and I think it paid off quite well for them...

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment: I'm just suggesting everyone lay off the fanboy perspective and try and approach things a little more objectively. For instance, I'm actually wondering what this reboot will lead to in the future of Marvel comic book adaptations.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment:
Spiderman 1 and 2 had good character development, great action scenes and final fight, and good plot. Which is way more than can be said about the lead up to The Avengers.

The only good movie in the Avengers series is the Avengers. The rest of them, Iron Man 1 and 2, Hulk, Thor, Captain America, lack any real depth, not much character development, meh finale fight. They really were not that good. But the Avengers was on the level of Spiderman 1 and 2.

Comment: I agree, but I think silly is what it needs. With everything trying to be "dark" all the time, I'm looking forward to something a little less serious and more fun. That's why I always liked Spider-Man. The whole idea of it is just so cheesy and ridiculous that even the more serious stories never go into territory that's more suited to something like Batman or Hellblazer. Even when the comics deal with death, it feels like they handle it in a way without just trying to be edgy or depressing.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment:
Raimi's series was much more lighthearted in vain of the 60s classic Stan Lee comicbook-y feel. The superhero movie genre was just being born and movies like the first X-Men and Spider-Man made the genre popular. They were cheesy but that's cause they were interpreting the cheesy feel of the older classic comics.

This reboot is more broody, darker, and more realistic similar to Nolan's Batman. It shows the darker side to Peter's life and how complex it is.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment: If you were a fan of the Raimi films and had never beeen introduced to the character prior to them, then you wouldn't know about this side of his character. Peter is the nervous, low in confidence side, whilst Spider-Man is his confident, cocky and sarcastic side. This is what makes the character so compelling. It is almost like he has dual identities. When he puts on the mask, he feels liberated by it. It frees him from the shackles of Peter Parker.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer

I think what people are most impressed by, is the way, in which, Garfield plays the role as Spider-Man. Spider-Man is known to be a smart-ass and has a very sarcastic playful side to him.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment:
I used to think that this movie wouldn't beat the original trilogy, but after seeing this trailer I'm almost positive that it will. The old movies tried to be a bit too dramatic for their own good, and left out one of Spidey's most important features:

His attitude!

That whole "if you're gonna steal cars, then don't dress like a car thief" thing was just classic. While the first movies were good, this one looks like it'll portray Spider-Man closer to the comics' version.

Comment: @Dreamportal16 It's not a remake, it's a relaunch. The Raimi series couldn't continue for a lot of reasons. Toby was having problems with his back, Raimi couldn't get a script out in the time that Sony had, and SM3 had really mixed reception. Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment: Spidey is a 50 year-old character, with a wealth of different titles, interpretations, and stories. He was not born with Tobey, folks. Remake, no. It's simply a fresh take told the way a new director wants to tell it. Frankly, with the abundant differences between this and the mythos that Raimi's trilogy established (e.g. webshooters, Gwen, Peter's parents), I do not see how anyone can deem the origin unnecessary. Hell, a lot of people still think that Batman Begins leads into '89 these days.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment:
This is a great example of how someone's first experience with a character shapes their image of them forever.  I'm 36, and read the comics in the 80s, so my Spidey is a 19 year old college student.  Some started on the cartoons, so he has that "25 year old average white guy" voice.  Younger kids have Tobey as their example.  Any other version therefore seems inherently wrong.

BTW, all of this is a reason to call each other retards and fags for having different ideas of a fictional character.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment: I liked Sam Raimi's work for the first two, but it will be nice to get a new interpretation. Marc Webb is a talented director with a unique vision. He is excellent with character development, which is essential to the Spider Man story. For those who dislike the fact that they are doing the origin story again... chill out. It will be different. Remember, there is a lot of source material to draw from. It is clear from what has been shown that he is taking a new direction while staying faithful.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment:
The complaints aren't about the actor changes.
Its primarily about:
1) This is a unnecessary remake, meant only to renew the rights for Spiderman to Columbia Pictures, so Marvel Studios can't buy the rights.
2) Sam Raimi isn't directing.
I want to see what this new director is going to bring, but Sam Raimi was the one who kept the humorous feeling of Spider-man alive even in the drama.
Right now it this feels more like a Batman film

Comment:
5 Reasons Why This Movie Will Be Awesome
1) Peter, Gwen, and everyone in high school LOOKS LIKE THEY BELONG IN HIGH SCHOOL
2) Web shooters, none of this organic web bullshit
3)They went with the Batman Begins approach and saved a better villan for a sequel (ie. Green Goblin)
4) Instead of an animated Spiderman flipping around and beating up bad guys, it looks like they got an acrobat to do all that stuff for real.
5) We actually may get to hear more about what happened to Peter's parents.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment: Here's what happened. Sam Raimi (director of the first 3 Spidermen) couldn't come to a creative agreement with Sony on a fourth Spiderman. If Sony didn't produce a new Spiderman at most every 5 years, the film rights would revert to Marvel. So they fired Raimi and fast tracked a reboot to retain the film rights to the Spider Man franchise. It's a reboot, including the character's backgrounds, and small things like Spidey's web being synthetic (like in the comics). Thumbs up for people to see.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 3D - Official Trailer
Comment:
I think I love it, just a little bit. Andrew Garfield looks great - if anything slightly geekier than Tobey Maguire (though I think Social Network helps there...) Emma Stone is just gorgeous and it looks like it'll be less angst-driven than the Peter/MJ storyline we had previously.
The action seems to have a definite zing to it, very kinetic, and it's great to see Dr Connors as the villain, tied more into Peter's history rather than Harry's. Thumbs up from here!
